page.title: 03Population of Ferryhill
page.content: Locals refer to Ferryhill as the vill- age but it is in fact a small town with population 11,500(1981 census). Until the early 20th Century Ferryhill was a small agricultural community.The opening of Dean and Chapter colliery in 1902 saw rapid expansion to a town of 10,000 population.This was because of the building of terraced houses at Dean Bank to provide homes for miners. The closure of the mine in 1965 saw a slight decline but in recent years there has been extensive building,both council and private ,which has accounted for the present population figures.
